title: Silicon Valley's latest hype: Eyeball-scanning silver orbs to confirm you're human
description: The project is called Worldcoin. It was co-founded by Sam Altman of ChatGPT fame. Its mission is to authenticate all the world's humans, one eyeball scan at a time.

title: A tiny house gives them hope: How a homeless family in Brazil got a fresh start
description: The Brazilian family saw their income evaporate during the pandemic. They couldn't afford to stay in their home. The city of São Paulo had a solution — but they thought it was too good to be true.

title: 4 people dead and 1 missing after an explosion destroys 3 structures in Pennsylvania
description: An explosion in western Pennsylvania destroyed three structures and damaged at least a dozen others Saturday morning, authorities said.

title: Caring for people with fentanyl addiction often means treating terrible wounds
description: The fentanyl-additive Xylazine causes open wounds, making the illegal drug supply even more dangerous and treatment more complicated

title: The future of crypto hinges on a fight between the SEC and a former burger flipper
description: A looming courtroom battle between the largest cryptocurrency exchange and the world's most powerful regulator promises to shape the future of crypto.

title: Why 'the guy' from The Office wants a spiritual revolution
description: Rainn Wilson's book calls for a spiritual revolution in America. And even though he himself is a very funny guy, he is not joking about this at all.

title: How hardworking microbes ferment cabbage into kimchi
description: An age-old technique transforms vegetables and spices into a popular condiment with a zesty, funky taste. The key? Nurturing the right community of microbes. Here's how the magic happens.
